column2: NEBRASKA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: next to the solid line may pass.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
3. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column10: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 4. The golden rule of driving is to:
column4: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.
column6: treat others the way you want to be treated.
column8: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 6. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 7. The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:
8. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
10. Using a smartphone to read, type or send written communication while operating a motor vehicle is:
11. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column10: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 12. What does this sign indicate?
13. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 14. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 15. Do not park a vehicle:
column4: within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.
column6: in front of a public or private driveway.
column8: on a roadway directly beside stopped or parked vehicles.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 17. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 18. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 19. A pentagon-shaped sign means:
20. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 21. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns close to the center line.
22. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column6: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column10: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 23. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 24. When you are about to make a left turn, you must signal at least _____ feet before turning.
25. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
